explanation: The 1988 Copa Libertadores final is widely regarded as one of Nacional’s most iconic nights. In that historic clash against Newell’s Old Boys, this lineup – featuring a blend of experienced defenders, creative midfielders, and lethal forwards – showcased the club at its absolute peak. Every player on the field contributed to a disciplined, tactically astute performance that not only secured the coveted continental title but also cemented Nacional’s legacy as one of CONMEBOL’s giants. The selected starting XI and key substitutes all featured in that official match, highlighting a once‐in‐a‐lifetime collection of talent and determination under coach Roberto Fleitas.
